Simon wrote:

	>What test runners do most ordinary folks [and not just the 
	>junit experts
	>who've been using it for years] use most, do those runner primarily
use
	>collectors, and do suites add value to those runners?

>	I drive all of my junit tests from ant and I don't use suites. Every
one of my unit tests stands alone 
>	and tests one functionality. I organise my tests so that they are in
the same namespace as the thing
>	being tested, and the ant junit task runs all of the tests in a
specific package before moving on to
>	another package.

Yes, *exactly* as I do, wether I am using Ant or Eclipse. I suspect this is
a trend brought on by ease, and I think that is a trend that could lead to a
valuable evolution.

I doubt enough folks read this list ('cos for most folks the above is
enough, junit works well enough, it is simple enough, so why come here .....
but I feel a poll of unit users might be in order. I know Internet poll
surveys exist, would this be one worth posting from the junit site? 

regards

Adam
